title: Is 'The Prince' by Niccolo Machiavelli a difficult read? - Quora

response.answer_text: It's written in Medieval Italian, so, if you're a monolingual American, it would/will be difficult. In translation into English, it is not difficult for so someone with schooling through at least 10th grade by standards in place to the late 1980s. I would recommend reading about “The Prince” in Cliffs Notes and others like it before you start. It's a lot easier to read and understand an opus when you have an idea of what to expect. Next you'll be reading Marcus Aurelius — and enjoying having read it. Much more enjoyment comes from having read a difficult work than in reading it.

In the original? Yeah…if you don’t speak Italian. The English translation(s) are pretty good. The book itself is an easy read - though I would advise you to get an annotated version as there is some contemporary context necessary to fully appreciate it.
